str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
